p:
Interferons are generally not recommended in acute viral hepatitis, but treatment of acute HCV with IFN-α has resulted in a more rapid resolution of viremia and reduced progression to chronic hepatitis.
134, 135 The American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases recommends either IFN-α or peginterferon-α for at least 6 months for acute HCV if infection persists for 2 to 4 months after diagnosis.
